intro: Lobelia senecionis, commonly known as yellow lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and thrives in well-drained soil. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Lobelia senecionis is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
